title: The Millennium Bridge: The Wobbly Opening Day
description: One-minute skill: The Millennium Bridge: The Wobbly Opening Day.

hook.text: London's Millennium Bridge opened in 2000. It swayed so violently that pedestrians grabbed the railings in terror.

buildup.text: Foster + Partners designed a sleek, flat suspension bridge across the Thames â€” beautiful and minimal.

discovery.text: When crowds walked across, their footsteps synchronized with the bridge's natural sway, amplifying it dangerously.

twist.text: The phenomenon â€” synchronous lateral excitation â€” was known in engineering but nobody applied it to pedestrian bridges.

climax.text: Dampers were added, the bridge reopened, and engineers worldwide updated their pedestrian bridge calculations.

punchline.text: A bridge designed for beauty forgot the most basic user: walking humans.

quiz.question: What caused London's Millennium Bridge to wobble?
options: Pedestrians' synchronized footsteps amplified the bridge's natural sway
